choices.text: Subcapital fracture of Neck of femur
Trans cervical fracture of Neck of femur
Basi cervical fracture of Neck of femur
Inter trochanteric fracture of Neck of femur

questions.text: Which of the following hip fractures is most likely to disrupt perfusion of the femoral head?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

More proximal the fracture line, more is incidence of AVN of head

questions.text: A 7 year old boy is brought by parents to Ortho OPD with chief complains of dull aching pain and inability to squat. His problems started with intense pain in the right hip two weeks ago for which he was treated conservatively and symptomatically. His blood investigations show raised ESR with other counts almost normal. X rays were done which showed osteopenia and mild erosions around the hip joint mainly towards the acetabular side. Which of the following is the correct diagnosis ?
If x ray changes were towards head of femur answer would have been Paget’s disease of bone Which of the following Implant terminology doesn't match with its Mechanism of Action?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

K Nail is based on three point fixation

choices.text: Hemi arthroplasty & MC indication is Avascular necrosis of femoral head
Total Hip Arthroplasty & MC indication is Inter-trochanteric femur fracture
Hemi arthroplasty & MC indication is Neck of femur fracture
Total Hip Arthroplasty & MC indication is Neck of femur fracture

questions.text: What is the name of the surgery and most common indication out of the options given below for the surgery performed in given X-ray :
Which of the following methods of treatment can not be used for fixing inter trochanteric fracture of femur?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Femur Interlocking Nails are used for diaphyses fractures of femur

questions.text: Major nerve supply of knee’s articular cartilage is :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Articular cartilage is avascular and aneural structure

questions.text: According to Dennis 3 column concept of spinal stability, which of the following structure doesn’t form the posterior column:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

PLL is a part of middle column

questions.text: Which of the following structure is not removed while doing anterolateral decompression in case of pott’s spine ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Anterolateral decompression comprises of removal of part of rib, transverse process, pedicle, part of vertebral body. Left sided approach is preferred as aorta is safe to handle

A 22 year old male sustained RTA 2 days ago in his village. He was given temporary aid overnight there and then shifted to another private nursing home in city near by the next day. As his admission was being done for definitive fixation of the fracture by the orthopedic surgeon , the doctors in emergency noted dropping oxygen saturation in blood along with impending delirium and disorientation. Within few minutes rashes started appearing over chest. What’s the correct diagnosis for this case?
All of the following are complications of supracondylar fracture humerus except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Non union is seen in fracture lateral condyle humerus

choices.text: This is due to over sympathetic stimulation
Sympatholytics can be given in the initial phase of disease
Vitamin C has got a little preventive role in this condition
It’s a clinical diagnosis where X-rays are usually Normal

questions.text: A 62 year old female sustained colles’ fracture 10 weeks ago. She was kept in immobilisation in cast since then till 2 days ago. As the cast was removed she complained of severe pain in wrist and hyperaesthesia. All of the following are true about this except :
Identify the lesion in the following X ray :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

GCT or osteoclastoma is classical for soap bubble appearance

questions.text: All of the following are included in Mirel’s criteria except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Mirel’s criteria includes size, site , nature and pain of lesion

choices.text: Most common bone tumor overall is Multiple myeloma followed by osteosarcoma
Most common bone tumor of hand is Enchondroma
Most common malignant bone tumor of hand is Chondrosarcoma
Most common tumor of hand is Squamous cell carcinoma

questions.text: All of the following are true except ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Most common bone tumor is metastasis

questions.text: A 10 year old boy is having pain and swelling in his right thigh for last two weeks. His parents give history of occasional fever in this duration. Blood counts reveal raised ESR and TLC. X-ray is done which shows the following distinct finding. Which of the following options is the BEST step for further diagnosis ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Next step : MRI 
Best step : Biopsy

choices.text: Asymptomatic lesions should be observed right from the first presentation of the patient
Thorough curettage and bone grafting to be done even for asymptomatic lesions at the first presentation
Initial trial of treatment can include intra lesional steroids
Intra lesional sclerosants can be tried intially as well and curettage should be reserved for symptomatic cases or recurrent cases

questions.text: A 11 year old boy was taken to a physician for recent episode of pneumonia and breathing issues. The physician gets a chest X-ray done which is shown in the image section. All of the following can be taken as treatment options except ?

choices.text: Most common cause of Genu Varum in elderly is Osteoarthritis
Most common cause of Genu Varum in children is Idiopathic
Most common cause of Genu Varum in elderly is Rheumatoid Arthritis
Most common cause of Genu Valgus in elderly is Osteoarthritis

questions.text: Which of the following is true :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Most common cause of Genu Varum in elderly is OA

choices.text: Osteomalacia has low serum levels of calcium and low ALP
Osteoporosis has normal serum levels of calcium and high ALP
Osteomalacia has high serum levels of calcium and high ALP
Osteoporosis has normal serum levels of calcium and normal ALP

questions.text: All of the following are true except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

In osteoporosis calcium , phosphate and ALP levels are normal

questions.text: All of the following are anti resorptive drugs in the management of Osteoporosis except ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

It’s an osteopromotive drug

choices.text: T Score less than -2.5 is classical of osteoporosis
Z score matches age , sex and race
DEXA scan is done covering wrist , knee and spine
T score between -1 & -2.5 is classical of Osteopenia

questions.text: All of the following options ate true except ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

DEXA scan covers hip , wrist and spine

choices.text: There is lack of compressive strength in bones
This is Type 1 collagen synthesis defect
Deformities and diaphyses fractures in different stages of healing are classical

questions.text: A 2 year old boy is presented to OPD with poor , abnormal and delayed dentition & petechial hemorrhagic patches. X-rays were done already which are attached here. Which of the following is not TRUE about the condition among the following options ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

There is lack of tensile strength in bones

questions.text: A 14 year adolescent boy is brought to OPD by his mother. He complains of pain in his knee. On examination there is tenderness and he ain’t able to extend the knee completely without pain. Both mother and son rule out any trauma in recent past but admit to boy participating in school athletic activities for last 6 months in excess. Blood counts appear normal. X-ray is advised and shown in the question. What is the diagnosis ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

It’s a radiological spotter

questions.text: Choose the best option out of the following for correct sequence of X-ray signs of Pott’s spine (first to last) 1. Loss of IV disc space 2. Bony ankylosis 3. Para vertebral soft tissue shadow 4. Vertebral body destruction

choices.text: Soft Callus is formed at 3 weeks
Woven bone is equivalent to first clinical sign of fracture union
Remodelling is conversion of lamellar bone to woven bone

questions.text: All of the following are TRUE about Fracture Healing except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Remodelling is conversion of woven bone to lamellar bone

choices.text: Formation of hematoma between the fracture fragments

questions.text: All of the following are causes of Non union except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Formation of hematoma between the fracture fragments is the first step to fracture healing

choices.text: Thorough irrigation and debridement with normal saline
External fixation to provide temporary splintage
Nailing of the bone followed by primary closure

questions.text: All of the following are included in the steps of management of the image shown below except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Internal fixation is avoided in open fractures due to fear of more infection

choices.text: Salter Harris Type V physeal trauma

questions.text: An 8 year old child had a fall from the roof. He complained of pain and swelling around the ankle. He was taken to a doctor where X-rays were done which showed almost nothing. Two years later, he developed 2 cm shortening & valgus deformity in ankle. What do you think was missed two years ago?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

SH V is due to fall from height where there is crushing of the growth plate

choices.text: Thenar atrophy is usually a late sign and shows irreversible nature of the disease
This is due to compression of superficial branch of median nerve under the flexor retinaculum
Temporary methods of treatment include splintage + Vit B12
Surgical release of the nerve is the final solution of the disease

questions.text: There is a 38 year old female who presents to the OPD with pain and tingling in her right hand more so in the night time. She has a history of gestational diabetes and family history of endocrinological manifestations. She has been complaining of body aches and pains more in winters too. On examination it’s observed that she is developing slight atrophy of thenar muscles as well. Which of the following statement ain’t true about this condition ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

This is due to compression of Deep branch of median nerve under the flexor retinaculum

questions.text: All of the following are properties of CTEV Shoes except :

choices.text: Open reduction & Internal fixation with Herbert screw

questions.text: Treatment of Displaced # Head of Radius in a young individual of 28 years of age is :

choices.text: Wait for the recovery of the radial nerve
Change the plaster and splint the upper limb in another position
Apply a U cast or coaptation splint for better immobilization
Immediate open reduction and internal fixation of the fracture with radial nerve exploration

Nerve injury is more common in Posterior dislocation of hip than anterior dislocation of hip
